intro: Valerianella amblyotis, commonly known as the small valerian, is a low-growing plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically forms a dense mat of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is part of the Caprifoliaceae family and is known for its aromatic foliage. Valerianella amblyotis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and visual appeal.
